gremlins

Class Wizard

  • java.lang.Object
    • gremlins.Entity
      • gremlins.Mobile
        • gremlins.Wizard

  • public class Wizard
extends Mobile
    Wizard class: The player controlled character that extends a mobile entity

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class gremlins.Mobile

        alive, collisionBlock, collisionEntity, direction, frameCounter, sideAV, speed, xDir, xVel, yDir, yVel

      • Fields inherited from class gremlins.Entity

        HEIGHT, WIDTH, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wizard(int x, int y, int speed, processing.core.PImage[] wizardSprites)
      Constructor for wizard object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void down()
      Overriden down method, that modifies the current wizard image, velocities, and direction of the wizard
      int draw(App app)
      Draw method for the wizard.
      void fireballMechanics(App app)
      FireballMechanics controls all the interactions between fireballs, and all other objects in the game This method is located in the wizard as every fireball within its available fireballs ArrayList must be updated.
      processing.core.PImage getCurrentImg()
      Getter method for the curent displayed Wizard image
      java.util.ArrayList<Fireball> getExistingFireballs()
      Getter method that returns the ArrayList of fireballs the wizard is in posession of (valid fireballs are those that have not hit any mobile or immobile entities and thus will still be drawn on screen)
      int getManaCoolDown()
      Getter method to get the amount of time until the wizard can next shoot a fireball
      boolean getTeleported()
      Getter method that gets whether the wizard has teleported in a teleport cycle.
      int getTpCooldown()
      Getter method for the teleport cooldown - the amount of time between valid teleports
      void left()
      Overriden method, that modifies the current wizard image, velocities, and direction of the wizard
      void right()
      Overriden right method, that modifies the current wizard image, velocities, and direction of the wizard
      void setExistingFireballs(java.util.ArrayList<Fireball> a)
      Setter method that sets the ArrayList of fireballs the wizard is in posession of (valid fireballs are those that have not hit any mobile or immobile entities and thus will still be drawn on screen)
      void setManaCooldown(int x)
      Setter method for the mana Cooldown (delay between fireball shots)
      void setTeleported(boolean b)
      Setter method that sets whether the wizard has teleported in a teleport cycle.
      void setTpCooldown(int x)
      Setter method to set the amount of time between the previous valid teleport request, and the next valid teleport
      void shoot()
      Shoot method creates a new fireball, adds it to the exisitng list of fireballs, then takes the newest one (indicated by the fact that it is the last one in the ArrayList) and moves it in the direction that the wizard is facing.
      int tick(App app)
      Tick method for the wizard hosts all the logic to deal with fireball firing, entity collision and interactions, valid and invalid motion/movements, and wizard death.
      void tp(App app)
      Teleport method that resets the wizard's current coordinates to new coordinates generated by the random generator.
      void up()
      Overriden Up method, that modifies the current wizard image, velocities, and direction of the wizard

      • Wizard

        public Wizard(int x,
              int y,
              int speed,
              processing.core.PImage[] wizardSprites)
        Constructor for wizard object
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        speed - how many pixels it moves per increment
        wizardSprites - An array of sprites the wizard will use

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentImg

        public processing.core.PImage getCurrentImg()
        Getter method for the curent displayed Wizard image
        Returns:
        a PImage that corresponds to the direction the wizard is facing

        public void setManaCooldown(int x)
        Setter method for the mana Cooldown (delay between fireball shots)
        Parameters:
        x - an integer to set the mana cooldown to

      • getManaCoolDown

        public int getManaCoolDown()
        Getter method to get the amount of time until the wizard can next shoot a fireball
        Returns:
        integer that corresponds to the mana cooldown

      • setTpCooldown

        public void setTpCooldown(int x)
        Setter method to set the amount of time between the previous valid teleport request, and the next valid teleport
        Parameters:
        x - an integer that corresponds with a new increment.

      • getTpCooldown

        public int getTpCooldown()
        Getter method for the teleport cooldown - the amount of time between valid teleports
        Returns:
        an integer that corresponds to the time between the previous and next valid teleport

      • setTeleported

        public void setTeleported(boolean b)
        Setter method that sets whether the wizard has teleported in a teleport cycle. Used in conjunction with the teleport times
        Parameters:
        b - boolean corresponding to whether the wizard has or has not teleported

      • getTeleported

        public boolean getTeleported()
        Getter method that gets whether the wizard has teleported in a teleport cycle. Used in conjunction with the teleport times
        Returns:
        boolean corresponding to whether the wizard has or has not teleported

      • getExistingFireballs

        public java.util.ArrayList<Fireball> getExistingFireballs()
        Getter method that returns the ArrayList of fireballs the wizard is in posession of (valid fireballs are those that have not hit any mobile or immobile entities and thus will still be drawn on screen)
        Returns:
        ArrayList of fireballs

      • setExistingFireballs

        public void setExistingFireballs(java.util.ArrayList<Fireball> a)
        Setter method that sets the ArrayList of fireballs the wizard is in posession of (valid fireballs are those that have not hit any mobile or immobile entities and thus will still be drawn on screen)
        Parameters:
        a - An ArrayList of Fireball objects

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        Shoot method creates a new fireball, adds it to the exisitng list of fireballs, then takes the newest one (indicated by the fact that it is the last one in the ArrayList) and moves it in the direction that the wizard is facing.

      • up

        public void up()
        Overriden Up method, that modifies the current wizard image, velocities, and direction of the wizard

        Overriden method, that modifies the current wizard image, velocities, and direction of the wizard

        left in class Mobile

      • tp

        public void tp(App app)
        Teleport method that resets the wizard's current coordinates to new coordinates generated by the random generator.
        Parameters:
        app - The app class, used to get data such as the current map's configuration

      • fireballMechanics

        public void fireballMechanics(App app)
        FireballMechanics controls all the interactions between fireballs, and all other objects in the game This method is located in the wizard as every fireball within its available fireballs ArrayList must be updated. This method checks every existing fireball whether it has collided, or interacted with. Split into two large sections (regarding mobile and immobile interactions)
        Parameters:
        app - A referene to the App class, where useful methods such as getMap and getMobiles are located

      • draw

        public int draw(App app)
        Draw method for the wizard. Draws the image of the wizard (if it is not null), and draws the teleport mechanics as all the variables associated with it are in this class
        Specified by:
        draw in class Mobile
        Parameters:
        app - takes in the App class object to use the methods it has extended from PApplet such as app.image()
        Returns:
        An integer corresponding to the direction the wizard is facing.

      • tick

        public int tick(App app)
        Tick method for the wizard hosts all the logic to deal with fireball firing, entity collision and interactions, valid and invalid motion/movements, and wizard death.
        Specified by:
        tick in class Mobile
        Parameters:
        app - the App class that hosts many useful parameters and methods such as getGArray()
        Returns:
        returns an integer that corresponds to whether the wizard is alive (0), dead (10), or running into the level's exit(20)
